author: sky.cactus
content: <@574864862338088960> are you planning on creating EIPs for 1559 transactions like `eth_sendTransaction`?

author: sky.cactus
content: Also, the block EIPs you have out don't appear to include the changes to transactions, which happens when someone calls those methods with `true` for the last parameter.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: I can spend some time today going through all the existing RPCs and come up with a list of RPCs that I think will change because of EIP-1559/2718/2930.

author: timbeiko
content: If you let me know what's missing, I can definitely add it.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Awesome I'll tkae a look.  Shouldn't those EIPs be a requirement for _testnet_ fork too?

author: sky.cactus
content: May want to remove the checkboxes on those block ones for now until they get fixed to include transactions.

author: timbeiko
content:
Yep, from the top of the doc: 
> Tasks that are normally part of the "AllCoreDevs process" are not listed. In other words, this list is what should ideally be done before moving EIP-1559 through the regular network upgrade process. 

Basically, this is what we need for 1559 to be a candidate for mainnet, not to go live

author: timbeiko
content: Yeah, this was pre-2718 txns. Will update now üëç

author: ryanleeschneider
content: My concern is that it sounds like on the ACD meeting Feb 24th was decided as the date for the testnet forks, that sounds premature given that these RPC changes haven't been solidified yet.

author: timbeiko
content: you mean the RPC changes for EIP-2718 transactions, not 1559, correct?

author: timbeiko
content: I think that's worth raising in <#745077610685661265> if so

author: timbeiko
content: Hmm, sorry, Micah told you to come here about that

author: timbeiko
content: I do think if you're concerned about 2718 + 2930 transactions, independent of 1559, then we need to surface this in <#745077610685661265>. Unless they are working on 1559, people don't pay attention to this channel
